title: Alpha: RSI + Volume Spike
text: Confidential: Buy signal triggers when 14D RSI < 25 AND volume is 2x 20D average on internal Universe-17 basket. Position size is 1.5% NAV with 2-day VWAP execution.

title: Risk Model: Caps + Vol Target
text: Confidential: Internal risk model uses sector cap = 18% and single-name cap = 3.5% with daily volatility targeting at 10% annualized. Hedge ratio uses rolling 60D beta.

title: Alpha: Earnings Drift Window
text: Confidential: After earnings, go long winners for 7 trading days if post-earnings gap > 2% and analyst revision z-score > 1.2. Exit at day 7 close; otherwise use 68/32 split between VWAP and POV execution.

title: Execution: Spread Guardrails
text: Confidential: If bid-ask spread > 10 bps for a name, route to passive limit only; otherwise use aggressive midpoint peg. Venue priority: IEX > EDGX > ARCA for dark execution.

title: Alpha: Momentum + Quality Filter
text: Confidential: 6M momentum rank top 15% AND accruals rank bottom 30% qualifies. Rebalance weekly on Friday close; hold 10 days.

title: Portfolio Construction: Turnover Budget
text: Confidential: Daily turnover budget is capped at 12% gross notional; if exceeded, defer lowest expected alpha orders to next session. Weekly max: 45%.

title: Client Note: Restricted Names List
text: Confidential: The clearance list (updated daily) includes Ticker AAPL, TSLA, and NVDA as restricted for discretionary add-ons during event window; require approval from compliance.

title: Alpha: Mean Reversion Short
text: Confidential: Short when 5D returns > +3 sigma from 60D mean AND insider selling detected in last 7 days. Cover when z-score < 0.3 or after 3 days.

title: Risk Control: Factor Neutralization
text: Confidential: Momentum alpha using internal factor model; enforce (beta) < 0.05 at portfolio level. Momentum using internal factor model across six Barra-style factors.

title: Data Holdings: Internal Universe Definition
text: Confidential: Universe-17 excludes ADRs, microcaps below 65%, and names with avg daily dollar volume < $25M; updated monthly.

title: Alpha: Insider + Options Activity
text: Confidential: Trigger buy when cluster insider purchases (>= 3 insiders within 14D) coincide with unusual options volume (call/put ratio > 2.5 on 20D avg). Size 0.8% NAV.

title: Alpha: Pairs Trade - Sector Spread
text: Confidential: When intra-sector pair spread z-score > 2.0 (90D rolling), enter long underperformer / short outperformer with 1:1 dollar neutral. Exit at z < 0.5 or 15D max hold.

title: Risk: Drawdown Circuit Breaker
text: Confidential: If daily PnL drawdown > -1.5% NAV, halt all new alpha trades for remainder of session. If weekly drawdown > -3%, reduce gross by 50% for next 5 trading days.

title: Alpha: Revenue Beat + Guidance
text: Confidential: Go long if Q earnings beat > 5% AND management raises FY guidance by > 2%. Entry at T+1 open, VWAP over first 30 min. Target hold 5D.

title: Execution: Dark Pool Routing
text: Confidential: For orders > 5000 shares, route 60% to internal crossing engine, 30% to Sigma-X, 10% to POSIT. Never route restricted names through external dark pools.

title: Alpha: Credit Spread Momentum
text: Confidential: When IG CDX spread narrows > 15 bps over 5D while HY CDX stable, go long equity beta via SPY calls. Size: 2% NAV notional, 30D expiry, delta 0.40.

title: Risk: Correlation Break Monitor
text: Confidential: If realized 20D pairwise correlation among top-10 holdings exceeds 0.75 (vs 0.45 historical avg), trigger portfolio-wide hedge overlay: buy 1M 5% OTM SPX puts sized at 0.5% NAV.

title: Alpha: Sentiment NLP Score
text: Confidential: Internal NLP model scores 10-K/10-Q filings on 0-100 sentiment scale. Long when delta-sentiment > +15 vs prior filing AND price < 200D SMA. Backtest Sharpe: 1.8 since 2018.

title: Client: Fee Structure Tier 3
text: Confidential: Tier-3 clients (AUM > $50M) receive 85 bps management + 15% performance fee above 6% hurdle. Seed investors get 50/10 until AUM reaches $500M.

title: Alpha: Macro Yield Curve Signal
text: Confidential: When 2Y-10Y spread inverts by > 25 bps AND ISM < 50, initiate defensive rotation: reduce cyclical exposure by 30%, increase utilities + staples allocation. Trigger reviewed monthly by CIO.

title: Alpha: Short Interest Squeeze Setup
text: Confidential: Identify names with short interest > 25% float, days-to-cover > 8, AND positive earnings surprise in last 30D. Enter long with tight stop at -5%. Target +15% or 10D exit.

title: Alpha: Dividend Capture Enhanced
text: Confidential: Enter 3D before ex-div for names with yield > 3% AND 20D realized vol < 15%. Hedge with ATM put spread costing < 40% of expected dividend. Exit T+1 after ex-div.

title: Risk: Liquidity Score Threshold
text: Confidential: Internal liquidity score (0-100) based on 20D ADTV, bid-ask spread, and market cap. Positions with score < 35 cannot exceed 0.5% NAV. Score < 20 requires PM approval.

title: Alpha: Cross-Asset Lead-Lag
text: Confidential: Copper futures 5D return > +2% leads industrial equities by 3-5 trading days with 67% hit rate. Enter XLI calls when copper signal fires, delta 0.50, 21D expiry.

title: Alpha: ETF Flow Reversal
text: Confidential: When sector ETF experiences > 3 standard deviation outflow (vs 60D) AND underlying fundamentals stable (earnings revisions flat), go long sector. Entry on day of extreme flow, hold 5D. Win rate 72%.

title: Execution: Algo Selection Matrix
text: Confidential: For urgency=low use TWAP 8hr; urgency=medium use arrival-price algo with 15% participation cap; urgency=high use aggressive VWAP 30min with no cap. Commission: internal crossing 0.5 bps vs external 2.0 bps.

title: Risk: Concentration Override Rules
text: Confidential: No single GICS sub-industry > 12% of gross. If breached intraday, auto-rebalance triggers at T+1 open. Exception: during earnings season, allow temporary 15% for 3 trading days with PM sign-off.

title: Alpha: Volatility Regime Switch
text: Confidential: When VIX crosses above 25 from below (regime switch), reduce net long exposure from 80% to 40% over 2 days. Simultaneously sell 30D 25-delta strangles on top-5 holdings to harvest elevated IV.

title: Client: Redemption Gate Policy
text: Confidential: Fund-level gate activates at 15% quarterly redemptions. Side pocket for illiquid positions (> 5% of NAV in names with liquidity score < 25). Lock-up: 12M hard, 6M soft with 3% penalty.

title: Alpha: Supply Chain Disruption
text: Confidential: Monitor internal satellite data feed for port congestion index. When index > 85th percentile AND shipping rates spike > 20% WoW, short consumer discretionary names with > 40% APAC supply chain exposure. Size 1% NAV per name, max 5 names.

title: Alpha: M&A Probability Model
text: Confidential: Internal M&A probability model combines: premium to sector median EV/EBITDA (weight 0.3), activist ownership (0.25), management turnover (0.2), strategic fit score (0.15), size compatibility (0.1). Score > 0.7 triggers research review; > 0.85 allows 0.5% NAV speculative position.

title: Risk: Stress Test Parameters
text: Confidential: Monthly stress scenarios: (1) rates +200bps with equity -15%, (2) credit spread +150bps with USD +8%, (3) oil -40% with EM equity -25%. Portfolio must survive all three with max drawdown < 8% NAV. Current vulnerability: scenario 2 shows -6.2%.

title: Alpha: Seasonality + Calendar
text: Confidential: Long small-cap value in January (size < $2B, P/B < 1.5) from Dec 20 to Jan 31. Backtest alpha: 3.2% avg over 15Y. Reduce position by 50% if VIX > 30 at entry. Fund allocation: max 5% NAV to this strategy.

title: Execution: Pre-Trade Impact Model
text: Confidential: Internal market impact model: expected slippage = 0.15 * (order_size / ADV)^0.6 * realized_vol * urgency_factor. For orders > 10% ADV, split across minimum 3 sessions. Impact threshold for escalation: > 25 bps predicted slippage requires trader desk approval.

title: Alpha: Convertible Arbitrage Parameters
text: Confidential: Target convertible bonds with delta 0.3-0.6, credit spread < 300bps, and conversion premium 15-35%. Hedge with 85% of theoretical delta in underlying equity. Rebalance delta daily if gamma exposure > 0.02.

title: Risk: Counterparty Exposure Limits
text: Confidential: Prime broker exposure cap: GS 35%, MS 30%, JPM 25%, other 10% each. Total rehypothecation limit: 140% of equity. Margin buffer maintained at 15% above maintenance requirement at all times.

title: Alpha: Fundamental Value Composite
text: Confidential: Internal value score = 0.25*FCF_yield + 0.20*EV_EBITDA_rank + 0.20*ROIC_stability + 0.15*dividend_growth + 0.10*buyback_yield + 0.10*debt_reduction. Rebalance quarterly. Long top decile, short bottom decile within each GICS sector.

title: Alpha: Dispersion Trade Setup
text: Confidential: When implied correlation index > 75 AND realized correlation < 50 (30D), sell index variance swap and buy single-stock variance on top-10 constituents. Target vega: $50K per unit. Max loss trigger: 2x initial premium received.

title: Committee: Quarterly Allocation Decision
text: Confidential: Q1 2025 IC decision: increase EM allocation from 8% to 12% (funded from US large cap reduction), add 3% to credit opportunities sleeve, maintain 15% cash buffer until March payroll data. Reviewed and approved by 4/5 IC members on Jan 15.

title: Alpha: Technical Breakout with Fundamental Filter
text: Confidential: Entry when price breaks above 52W high with volume > 1.5x 20D avg AND earnings growth > 15% YoY AND analyst coverage >= 5. Position 1% NAV. Stop-loss at breakout level -3%. Trailing stop at 10% from peak.

title: Alpha: Option Skew Reversal
text: Confidential: When 25-delta put skew > 90th percentile (1Y lookback) AND no pending catalyst within 30D, sell 1M 25-delta puts and buy 1M 10-delta puts as risk reversal. Target credit: > 1.5% of strike. Max 0.3% NAV risk per position.

title: Risk: Factor Exposure Bands
text: Confidential: Permitted factor exposure ranges (z-score vs benchmark): Size [-0.3, +0.5], Value [-0.2, +0.4], Momentum [-0.1, +0.6], Quality [+0.1, +0.5], Volatility [-0.5, -0.1]. Daily automated check; breach generates alert to risk desk.

title: Alpha: Activist Catalyst Play
text: Confidential: When known activist files 13D with > 5% stake AND company trades below 3Y avg EV/EBITDA, enter long with 0.8% NAV. Add 0.4% if activist proposes board seats. Exit if activist reduces stake below 4% or after 180D.

title: Execution: Closing Auction Strategy
text: Confidential: For index rebalance trades, submit 40% of order to closing auction with limit at +/- 20 bps from last print. Remaining 60% execute via TWAP in final 30 minutes. Priority: minimize tracking error vs benchmark close.

title: Alpha: Multi-Factor ML Signal
text: Confidential: XGBoost model trained on 47 features (fundamental + technical + alternative data) predicts 5D forward returns. Feature importance: short_interest (12.3%), earnings_revision (10.8%), IV_skew (9.1%), insider_flow (7.4%). Model retrained monthly on rolling 3Y window. Live Sharpe: 2.1 since 2022.

title: Risk: Tail Risk Hedging Budget
text: Confidential: Allocate 0.25% NAV monthly to tail risk hedges. Primary instrument: 3M 10% OTM SPX puts, rolled monthly. Secondary: long VIX calls when VIX < 15. Annual cost budget: 3% NAV. Performance drag acceptable if portfolio survives -20% market event with < -8% drawdown.

title: Alpha: FX Carry with Momentum Filter
text: Confidential: Long top-3 G10 carry currencies vs short bottom-3, but only if 1M momentum aligns with carry direction. Position size: 5% NAV per pair, max 15% gross. Stop-loss: if carry trade basket drawdown > 2% in any week, flatten all positions.

title: Client: Performance Reporting Methodology
text: Confidential: Client reports use gross-of-fee returns for attribution, net-of-fee for cumulative performance. Benchmark: 60% MSCI ACWI + 30% Bloomberg Agg + 10% HFRX. Alpha calculation excludes first 90 days of new strategy deployment. Clawback provision: 3Y high-water mark with 50% crystallization.

title: Alpha: ESG Momentum Tilt
text: Confidential: Overweight names with MSCI ESG rating upgrade in last 6M by 1.5x vs sector weight. Underweight downgrades by 0.5x. Additional filter: controversy score must be < 5 (on 0-10 scale). This ESG tilt adds ~40bps alpha annually per backtest.

title: Risk: Leverage Policy Tiers
text: Confidential: Gross leverage tiers: Normal (< VIX 20): max 200% gross. Elevated (VIX 20-30): reduce to 150% over 2 days. Crisis (VIX > 30): reduce to 100% immediately. Net exposure: always between 20% and 80% long. Leverage calculation includes notional value of derivatives at delta-adjusted basis.

title: General: RSI Mean Reversion Approach
text: Our desk employs RSI-based mean reversion signals, typically looking for oversold conditions in liquid large-cap equities with fundamental support.

title: General: Momentum Strategy Overview
text: We run a systematic momentum strategy that ranks stocks by recent price performance and overweights top performers with quality filters applied.

title: General: Risk Management Framework
text: Our risk framework incorporates sector concentration limits, factor exposure monitoring, and drawdown-based position sizing adjustments.

title: General: Earnings-Based Trading
text: The team trades around earnings events, taking positions based on earnings surprise magnitude and forward guidance changes relative to consensus.

title: General: Options Overlay Strategy
text: We maintain a systematic options overlay program that sells premium during high implied volatility environments while hedging tail risk during low volatility periods.

title: General: Multi-Factor Ranking
text: Our stock selection uses a multi-factor model combining value, quality, and momentum signals to generate a composite ranking score for the investment universe.

title: General: Dark Pool Usage
text: For large institutional orders, we route a significant portion through dark pools and internal crossing networks to minimize market impact.

title: General: Macro Rotation Philosophy
text: Our macro sleeve rotates between cyclical and defensive sectors based on leading economic indicators and yield curve signals.

title: General: ESG Integration
text: ESG considerations are integrated into our investment process through proprietary scoring and engagement, with ESG momentum used as an alpha signal.

title: General: Alternative Data Usage
text: The research team leverages alternative data sources including satellite imagery, web scraping, and NLP-based sentiment analysis for investment signals.

title: Practitioner: RSI Oversold
text: Many quantitative traders consider RSI below 30 as oversold and a potential buying opportunity, often combining it with volume confirmation.

title: Practitioner: Momentum Factor
text: Cross-sectional momentum strategies typically rank stocks by 12-month minus 1-month returns and go long top decile while shorting bottom decile.

title: Practitioner: Post-Earnings Drift
text: Academic research shows stocks that beat earnings estimates tend to drift higher for several weeks after the announcement, a well-documented anomaly.

title: Practitioner: Pairs Trading
text: Statistical arbitrage via pairs trading involves finding cointegrated stock pairs and trading mean reversion of their spread, typically measured in z-score terms.

title: Practitioner: Volatility Selling
text: Systematic volatility selling strategies profit from the volatility risk premium, the tendency of implied volatility to exceed realized volatility over time.

title: Practitioner: Factor Investing
text: Modern factor investing frameworks typically include value, momentum, quality, size, and low volatility factors, each backed by decades of academic research.

title: Practitioner: Market Impact
text: Market impact models estimate that trading costs increase with the square root of order size relative to average daily volume, an empirical finding known as the square-root law.

title: Practitioner: Carry Trade
text: Currency carry trades involve borrowing in low-yielding currencies and investing in high-yielding ones, profiting from the interest rate differential minus exchange rate movements.

title: Practitioner: Risk Parity
text: Risk parity portfolios allocate capital such that each asset class contributes equally to total portfolio risk, often using leverage to achieve target returns.

title: Practitioner: ESG Investing
text: ESG integration in portfolio management involves using environmental, social, and governance factors alongside financial analysis to identify risks and opportunities.

title: Textbook: What is RSI
text: The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is a momentum oscillator that measures the speed and magnitude of price changes on a scale from 0 to 100, developed by J. Welles Wilder Jr.

title: Textbook: What is EBITDA
text: EBITDA stands for Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization. It is a measure of a company's operating performance that strips out non-cash charges and capital structure effects.

title: Textbook: Beta Explanation
text: Beta measures a stock's sensitivity to market movements. A beta of 1.0 means the stock moves with the market; greater than 1.0 indicates higher volatility relative to the market.

title: Textbook: VWAP Definition
text: Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) is a trading benchmark calculated by dividing the total dollar value of trades by total volume. It represents the average price a security has traded at throughout the day.

title: Textbook: What is a Stop-Loss
text: A stop-loss order is designed to limit an investor's loss on a position. It automatically triggers a sell order when the price falls to a specified level below the purchase price.

title: Textbook: Mean Reversion
text: Mean reversion is a financial theory suggesting that asset prices and historical returns eventually revert to their long-run mean or average level over time.

title: Textbook: What is VIX
text: The VIX, known as the fear index, measures the market's expectation of 30-day forward-looking volatility, derived from S&P 500 index option prices.

title: Textbook: Yield Curve
text: The yield curve plots interest rates of bonds with equal credit quality but differing maturity dates. An inverted yield curve, where short-term rates exceed long-term rates, has historically preceded recessions.

title: Textbook: P/E Ratio
text: The Price-to-Earnings ratio divides a company's share price by its earnings per share. It indicates how much investors are willing to pay per dollar of earnings and is used for relative valuation.

title: Textbook: Diversification
text: Diversification is a risk management strategy that mixes a variety of investments within a portfolio. The rationale is that different assets will yield higher long-term returns and lower overall risk.
